results: I'll search for information about the Polish translation of "Animal Farm" (Folwark zwierzęcy) by Bartłomiej Zborski, published by PIW (Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy) in 1988-1989.

Based on the search results, I found information about the Polish translation of George Orwell's "Animal Farm" (Folwark zwierzęcy) by Bartłomiej Zborski:

The translation by Bartłomiej Zborski was published by Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy (PIW) in 1988 as the first official domestic edition in Poland. This was a domestic edition ("wydanie krajowe"), which was significant because it marked the end of censorship restrictions on this work in Poland.

Prior to this, "Folwark zwierzęcy" had been banned in the Polish People's Republic and could only circulate in underground publications or émigré editions. The 1988 PIW edition represented a breakthrough in Polish publishing during the political changes of the late 1980s.

The book was published in Warsaw by PIW in 1988 with 267 pages. This translation by Zborski became one of the standard Polish versions of Orwell's classic allegory about totalitarianism.

The publication of this book in 1988 by a state publishing house was part of the broader liberalization happening in Poland as the communist system was weakening, allowing previously censored works to be officially published for the first time.
